titlestmt.titleproper: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, Awards and Artifacts, RG 9
A Guide to the John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, Awards and Artifacts, RG 9 FA1803

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-10-01 04:57:17 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, Awards and Artifacts, RG 9

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation

physdesc.extent: 6 containers: 1 half legal box; 2 letter boxes, 3 card file boxes

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Knight Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Knight Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Record Group 9 contains awards and artifacts from various Knight Foundation programs. Most of the material in this collection is comprised of physical awards and objects, only a small amount of material is paper records.

physdesc.extent: 1 letter document box and 1 half-legal box

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three dies - one of Knight Foundation and two of "KF" (different sizes) used for printing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Metal plaque re: antique wood type, metal type and engravings was presented to KF by Lloyd Schermer, the artist who created the large piece, Wisdom's Puzzle I, 2004, which is in the KF board room. The plaque explains the printing process and type which have been used to create the art piece.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Black Male Engagement (BME) Challenge, an initiative co-sponsored by Open Society Foundation's Campaign for Black Male Achievement and KF, held a BME Challenge Celebration in Detroit. Artifacts are: a program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gold commemorative medallion issued on the opening of the MLK memorial in Washington, DC; invitation to the dedication; and Memorial booklet. KF was a sponsor of the memorial.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four pins with a cardboard holder commemorating the Knight News Challenge 2012. The pins include images of the KF logo, a "retro" cell phone, a dog, and abstract image. Also included are 8 additional pins, which were distributed in 2013 and 2014 and feature cartoon-type figures.

did.unittitle: Media Learning Seminar: Information Needs of Communities in a Democracy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials presented to participants attending the seminar, which took place in Coral Gables, FL. The seminar was jointly sponsored by the Knight Foundation and the Council on Foundations. Presentation items consisted of a notebook and pen and a copy of featured speaker Gwen Ifil's book, "The Break-through: politics and race in the age of Obama". (The book has been put in the KF library collection.)

did.unittitle: Broadcast in a Box: A Toolkit for Teaching High School Electronic Journalism

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kit contains: Great Ideas for your Classroom - Booklet and DVD; The First Amendment - Keep It Strong - CD-ROM; RTNDA's Code of Ethics and Professional Conduct - wallet sized; Plugged In: Using the Internet for High School (and Professional) Journalism - booklet; Reaching Generation Next: A News Media Guide to Creating Successful High School Partnerships - Book. The toolkit was supported by the Knight Foundation.

did.unittitle: Broadcast in a Box: High School Electronic Journalism Project

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This item was imaged from a DVD in 2023.

did.unittitle: Broadcast in a Box: The First Amendment - Keep It Strong! - Curriculum and Teaching Guide for 45 Words of Freedom

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This item was imaged from a CD-R in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kit contains resource literature, flash cards, and DVD, all aimed at easing the transition of permanent residents into American culture and into citizenship.

physdesc.extent: 3 letter document boxes and 2 card file boxes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes submissions, citations and certificates re: The Wilmer Shields Rich Awards for Excellence in Communications and the ACE Awards competition sponsored by the Akron chapter of Women in Communications, Inc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Glass, desktop, award for winners of the Knight News Challenge.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Glass award with metal stand given to Knight News Challenge winners.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Glass award given to Knight Arts Partnership winners.

did.unittitle: Knight Named Outstanding National Foundation of the Year

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The award was presented by the Association of Fundraising Professionals. This is a memo explaining the award, which was presented in 2010.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Glass award given to Knight Arts winners.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Glass award given to Knight News Challenge winners.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Glass awards given to Knight Arts Challenge winners in the Miami area (2010, 2011, 2012, 2013) and Philadelphia (2011, 2012). One 2013 Award is the People's Choice award.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Glass award given to Black Male Engagement (BME) Leadership Award winners.
